intro: Mesembryanthemum woodburniae, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or golden bush, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It produces small, edible fruits that are often used in local cuisine. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular ornamental plant in dry climates.
